summary: Email correspondence between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and attorneys from Sullivan & Cromwell LLP regarding a grand jury subpoena to TD Bank for accounts related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss the process of closing certain accounts, holding others open for the investigation, and the production of financial records.

persons.name: Nicolas Bourtin
persons.role: Attorney at Sullivan & Cromwell LLP representing TD Bank
persons.context: Primary point of contact for the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the grand jury subpoena to TD Bank. He coordinates the bank's response, including closing accounts and producing records related to Epstein.

persons.name: Gillian P. Seaman
persons.context: Corresponds with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the delivery of data (a hard drive) in response to the grand jury subpoena and provides access instructions.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.role: Authorized signer for JSC Interiors LLC account
persons.context: Identified as the authorized signer for a TD Bank account held in the name of 'JSC Interiors LLC,' which is part of the financial records subpoenaed in the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Sullivan & Cromwell LLP working together on the TD Bank response to the grand jury subpoena.
Bourtin, representing TD Bank, is involved in the process of handling and potentially closing financial accounts for which Kahn is an authorized signer.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to TD Bank
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued to TD Bank N.A. by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Formal Request to Keep Accounts Open
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sent a formal letter requesting that specific TD Bank accounts related to the investigation be kept open for an additional month.

events.title: Confirmation to Close Accounts
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office confirmed that TD Bank could close the specific accounts referenced in a prior 'hold-open' letter, as they were no longer needed to be kept open.

locations: Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Sullivan & Cromwell LLP, 125 Broad Street, New York, NY 10004-2498
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's finances via a grand jury subpoena to TD Bank in late 2019.
The investigation involved specific accounts, including eight under 'HBRK Associates' and one for 'JSC Interiors LLC' with Richard Kahn as the authorized signer.
The correspondence reveals a cooperative process between prosecutors and bank attorneys to manage account closures while preserving evidence for the investigation.
Financial data was produced by the bank on a hard drive, indicating a substantial volume of records was being examined.
